conclusion: Use the v-t graph to determine if the distance fallen is greater or less than 100 meters.
The x-axis represents time in seconds, and the y-axis represents velocity in meters per second.
Calculate the area under the v-t curve between 0 and 10 seconds to find the distance fallen.
Approximate the area under the curve by considering the shape of the curve.
The curve appears to form a triangle-like shape for the first 10 seconds with a base of 10 seconds and a height of approximately 10 m/s.
Use the triangle area formula to calculate the area: Area = 1/2 * base * height = 50 meters.
The actual distance fallen will be more than the area of the triangle due to increasing velocity.
The distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is greater than 100 meters.
